meanings.definition: A colored fluid used for writing or drawing.
meanings.sent1: I spilled ink on my paper while drawing a picture.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new bottle of ink for her calligraphy hobby.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the ink bottle, creating a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: His words flowed from his pen like ink onto the page.
meanings.sent5: The ink shimmered under the light, revealing its vibrant color.

meanings.definition: To mark or stain with ink.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally inked his shirt while refilling the pen.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully inked the outlines of the sketch.
meanings.sent3: She playfully inked a fake mustache on her friend's face.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day are forever inked in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The tattoo artist skillfully inked the intricate design on her arm.

meanings.definition: To sign or write with ink.
meanings.sent1: The author inked his signature on the title page of the book.
meanings.sent2: She carefully inked her name on the dotted line of the contract.
meanings.sent3: The student nervously inked the answers on the exam paper.
meanings.sent4: His commitment to the cause was inked in every word he wrote.
meanings.sent5: The poet inked his emotions onto the blank page, creating a masterpiece.
